definition: to place great importance on/to treasure

sentences.english: She sets great store by this old picture.
She was Dan's favorite model, cherished confidante and dearest friend.
sentences.chinese: 她是丹最愛的偶像，珍視的紅顏知己和摯友。

sentences.english: Azimov said that Uzbekistan cherishes the friendly partnership with China.
sentences.chinese: 阿濟莫夫說，烏方珍視同中國的友好合作夥伴關係。

sentences.english: Douglas had his own treasured jokes and sequences in the original radio series.
sentences.chinese: 道格拉斯自己對廣播劇中某些笑話和段落十分珍視。

sentences.english: In fact, universal love and caring, are worthy of our cherished ideas.
sentences.chinese: 其實兼愛與仁愛一樣，都是值得我們珍視的思想。

sentences.english: But the truth is that I came to cherish Japan's civility and selflessness.
sentences.chinese: 但事實是，我珍視日本的文明禮貌和無私精神。
張志豪十分珍視這次的經歷。

sentences.english: The ancient Egyptians prized propolis as an embalming agent.
sentences.chinese: 古埃及人將蜂膠珍視爲一種防腐劑。

sentences.english: I swear that, from now on, I will treasure rather than underestimate myself.
sentences.chinese: 我宣誓，從今往後，讓我珍視自己不再妄自菲薄。

sentences.english: The Aztec culture in current day Mexico also prized chocolate.
sentences.chinese: 當今阿之臺克文化中，墨西哥人也珍視巧克力。

sentences.english: But it turns out that time shifting is ourmost valued product.
sentences.chinese: 不過現在看來，非實時性產品反倒成爲我們最珍視的。

sentences.english: With the development of The Times, the kindergarten male teache begin attention by people.
sentences.chinese: 隨着時期的生長，幼兒園男西席開始受到人們的珍視。

sentences.english: An honest soul cherishes honor more than wealth.
sentences.chinese: 誠實的心靈珍視榮譽勝於珍視財富。

sentences.english: An honest soul cherishes honor more than wealth.
sentences.chinese: 誠實的心靈珍視榮譽勝於珍視財富。

sentences.english: He said that the Fijian people would always remember the friendly sentiments cherished by the Chinese people towards them.
sentences.chinese: 斐濟人民珍視並將永遠銘記偉大中國人民的友好情誼。

sentences.english: China cherishes its friendship with the other countries in Asia.
sentences.chinese: 中國珍視同亞洲其他各國的友誼。

definition: to sublimate/sublimation (physics)/to raise to a higher level/to refine/promotion
to offer respectfully/to consecrate/to dedicate/to devote
